clinical_study.brief_title: Community Based Screening for Colorectal Cancer in an Underserved High Risk Population in Nigeria
clinical_study.official_title: Colorectal Cancer Control in Low Resource Countries: Results From a Prospective Cohort Study of Patients at High-risk for Colorectal Cancer

collaborator.agency: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, USA

brief_summary.textblock: Patient age 45 year old and above who presented with rectal bleeding at three tertiary hospitals in South West Nigeria were invited for colonoscopy. The clinical information of the patients and the colonoscopy data were analyzed

detailed_description.textblock: Patient age 45 year old and above who presented with rectal bleeding at Obafemi Awolowo University Teaching Hospitals Complex, Ile Ife, Nigeria, University College Hospital, Ibadan, Nigeria, and University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital, Ilorin Nigeria were invited for colonoscopy. Categorical variables were compared using Ï‡2-test or Fisher's exact test while the Kruskal-Wallis test was used for quantitative variables. Multivariate analysis was performed using logistic regression model. All statistical tests were two-sided and p-values below 0.05 were considered statistically significant. Statistical analysis was carried out using SAS 9.4 and R 3.3.1.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine colonoscopy polyp and cancer detection rate
primary_outcome.description: The hypothesis for this study was that colonoscopy surveillance of a high-risk cohort of patients with rectal bleeding would demonstrate that 10-20% of these patients have pre-malignant colorectal polyps(adenomas) or cancers.

secondary_outcome.measure: To detect colorectal cancer early using symptoms based assessment
secondary_outcome.description: The long-term impact of identifying at risk patients and patients with early stage cancers may be a reduction in mortality from colorectal cancer in low- and middle- income countries

arm_group.description: All the patients with rectal bleeding who had colonoscopy performed at Obafemi Awolowo University Teaching Hospitals Complex
All the patients with rectal bleeding who had colonoscopy performed at University College Hospital, Ibadan and University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital

biospec_descr.textblock: Colonic polyps and colorectal cancer specimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- must be 45-years of age or older
- has rectal bleeding lasting at least one week
- has had a complete colonoscopy performed
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals with a personal history of inflammatory bowel disease, colorectal polyps, colorectal adenoma or CRC
- Individuals with a family history of familial adenomatous polyposis syndromes or other hereditary polyposis syndromes, hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer
- Individuals with severe comorbidities that were contraindication to colonoscopy
- Individuals who had a previous history of colectomy
